"There are those plays that come into sharp focus only when they’re almost over. You regret not having seen the play twice even before you’ve finished seeing it once."

Read more
fullText:
There are those plays that come into sharp focus only when they’re almost over. You regret not having seen the play twice even before you’ve finished seeing it once.

Martyna Majok’s challenging new drama, “Cost of Living,” which opened Wednesday at the Manhattan Theatre Club, tells parallel stories of two caretakers and their respective patients.
